etymologies: late 17th century: from Greek thematikos, from thema (see theme)

definitions: having or relating to subjects or a particular subject

examples.text: the orientation of this anthology is essentially thematic

shortDefinitions: having or relating to subjects or particular subject

definitions: relating to the collecting of postage stamps with designs connected with the same subject; topical

examples.text: for the thematic collector volcanoes represent a treasure trove

shortDefinitions: relating to collecting of postage stamps with designs connected with same subject

definitions: relating to or containing melodic subjects

examples.text: the concerto relies on the frequent repetition of thematic fragments

shortDefinitions: relating to or containing melodic subjects

definitions: belonging to, relating to, or denoting the theme of a sentence

examples.text: some languages use special affixes to mark thematic and non-thematic elements

definitions: relating to the theme of an inflected word.
shortDefinitions: relating to theme of inflected word

definitions: (of a vowel) connecting the theme of a word to its inflections.
shortDefinitions: (of vowel) connecting theme of word to its inflections

definitions: (of a word) having a vowel connecting its theme to its inflections.
shortDefinitions: (of word) having vowel connecting its theme to its inflections

definitions: a body of topics for study or discussion

examples.text: I soon gave up trying to prime him with the thematics of the piece

shortDefinitions: body of topics for study or discussion

definitions: a postage stamp forming part of a set with designs connected with the same subject; a topical.
shortDefinitions: postage stamp forming part of set with designs connected with same subject
